item.title: 国际货币基金组织称美国税收和支出法案与削减赤字建议背道而驰
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）发言人朱莉-科扎克（Julie Kozack）周四表示，即将在国会进行最终投票的美国大规模税收和支出法案与国际货币基金组织关于华盛顿在中期内减少财政赤字的建议背道而驰。【原文：The massive U.S. tax and spending bill slated for a final vote in Congress runs counter to the International Monetary Fund's recommendations that Washington reduce fiscal deficits over the medium term, IMF spokesperson Julie Kozack said on Thursday.】

item.title: 解说员：农产品为何阻碍印美贸易协议？
item.description: 美国和印度的贸易谈判代表周三力争在唐纳德-特朗普总统规定的7月9日谈判截止日期之前敲定一项降低关税的协议，但在美国乳制品和农业方面的分歧仍未得到解决。【原文：U.S. and India trade negotiators were pushing on Wednesday to finalise a tariff-reducing deal ahead of President Donald Trump's July 9 negotiating deadline, but disagreements over U.S. dairy and agriculture remained unresolved.】

item.title: 美联储主席博斯蒂克适应特朗普政策可能需要一年或更长时间
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周四表示，美国很可能面临一段通胀高企的时期，这有可能渗入消费者心理，企业可能需要一年或更长的时间来适应贸易和其他政策方面正在发生的转变，他阐明了在降息之前保持耐心的理由。【原文：The U.S. is likely facing a period of elevated inflation that risks seeping into consumer psychology, with companies likely needing a year or longer to adjust to the shifts underway in trade and other policies, Atlanta Fed president Raphael Bostic said on Thursday, spelling out the case for patience before any rate cuts.】

item.title: 受关税影响，4、5月份德国汽车对美出口下滑
item.description: 德国汽车工业协会（VDA）周四表示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收的进口关税打击了德国汽车制造商在其最重要的海外市场的销售，德国4月和5月对美国的汽车出口大幅下降。【原文：German car exports to the United States fell sharply in April and May as import tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump hit German automakers' sales in their most important foreign market, the VDA industry association said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 5 月工厂订单因飞机需求强劲而反弹
item.description: 由于对飞机的需求强劲，5 月份美国制成品的新订单激增，第二季度过半时企业的设备支出似乎也很强劲。【原文：New orders for U.S.-manufactured goods surged in May on strong demand for aircraft and business spending on equipment appeared to be strong halfway through the second quarter.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，峰会与阿斯利康就 150 亿美元的合作协议进行谈判
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，Summit Therapeutics 公司和阿斯利康公司正在讨论一项价值高达 150 亿美元的合作交易。【原文：Summit Therapeutics and AstraZeneca are discussing a partnership deal worth as much as $15 billion, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 在辛特拉度假胜地，各国央行行长探讨其领域面临的威胁
item.description: 在葡萄牙辛特拉山区举行的年度会议上，各国央行行长本周直面了他们控制全球货币体系所面临的日益严峻的挑战，从对美国联邦储备局的政治攻击到稳定币的崛起，不一而足。【原文：At their annual gathering in the hills of Portugal's Sintra, central bankers this week confronted rising challenges to their control of the global money system, from political attacks on the U.S. Federal Reserve to the rise of stablecoins.】

item.title: 英伟达将成为全球历史上最有价值的公司
item.description: 周四，随着华尔街对人工智能的乐观情绪加倍升温，英伟达有望成为历史上最有价值的公司，这家芯片制造商的市值达到 3.92 万亿美元。【原文：Nvidia was on track to become the most valuable company in history on Thursday, with the chipmaker's market capitalization reaching $3.92 trillion as Wall Street doubled down on optimism about AI.】

item.title: 日本首相石破称特朗普总统在某些关税问题上可能存在误解
item.description: 日本首相石破茂（Shigeru Ishiba）周四表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在一些关税相关问题上的观点可能是基于误解或错误信息，因为对日本进口商品征收24%互惠关税的暂停措施将于下周到期。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said on Thursday U.S. President Donald Trump's views on some tariff-related issues may be based on misunderstanding or misinformation, as a pause on a 24% reciprocal tariff on imports from Japan expires next week.】

item.title: 巴西总统卢拉敦促南方共同市场深化与亚洲的关系
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）周四表示，南美洲国家组成的南方共同市场集团应重点加强与亚洲国家的联系，他称亚洲是全球经济的 "活力中心"。【原文：Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said on Thursday that the Mercosur bloc of South American countries should focus on strengthening its ties with Asian nations, which he described as the "dynamic center" of the global economy.】

item.title: 美国服务业反弹，但就业再次萎缩
item.description: 由于订单反弹，美国服务业活动在 6 月份有所回升，但就业人数出现了今年以来的第三次萎缩，凸显了政策不确定性对企业的影响。【原文：U.S. services sector activity picked up in June as orders rebounded, but employment contracted for the third time this year, underscoring the impact of policy uncertainty on businesses.】

item.title: 美国关税不确定性和欧佩克+产量预期导致石油价格下跌
item.description: 油价周四小幅下跌，原因是在主要产油国预期增加供应之前，美国恢复关税的可能性引发了对需求的质疑。【原文：Oil prices fell slightly on Thursday as the possibility of U.S. tariffs being reinstated raised questions about demand ahead of an expected supply boost by major producers.】

item.title: 摩根大通对稳定币的万亿美元增长押注保持警惕，将其削减一半
item.description: 摩根大通（J.P.Morgan）周四预测，到 2028 年，稳定币的增长将仅达到 5000 亿美元，并称万亿美元的预测 "过于乐观"，因为几乎没有证据表明这种与美元挂钩的加密代币已被主流采用。【原文：J.P.Morgan on Thursday forecast stablecoin growth will only reach $500 billion by 2028, calling trillion-dollar projections "far too optimistic", as there was little evidence of mainstream adoption of the dollar-pegged cryptocurrency token.】

item.title: 麦格理为南方水务提供 16.3 亿美元融资后，穆迪上调南方水务评级展望
item.description: 评级机构穆迪（Moody's）周四将南方水务公司（Southern Water）的评级展望从 "下调审查 "上调至 "稳定"，此前这家英国水务公司从澳大利亚麦格理（Macquarie）获得了股权救命稻草，并通过信贷再融资避免了债务危机。【原文：Ratings agency Moody's on Thursday raised Southern Water's outlook to stable from a review for downgrade, after the British water utility secured an equity lifeline from Australia's Macquarie and a credit refinancing to avert a debt crisis.】

item.title: 出口疲软导致美国 5 月贸易逆差扩大
item.description: 由于出口下降，美国 5 月份的贸易赤字急剧扩大，但进口减弱表明，贸易仍可引领第二季度经济增长的预期反弹。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit widened sharply in May as exports fell, but subsiding imports suggested trade could still lead an anticipated rebound in economic growth in the second quarter.】

item.title: Thoma Bravo 将收购 Olo，餐饮技术公司估值 20 亿美元
item.description: 餐饮软件供应商 Olo 周四表示，该公司将被投资公司 Thoma Bravo 全现金收购，交易估值约为 20 亿美元。【原文：Restaurant software provider Olo said on Thursday it would be acquired by investment firm Thoma Bravo in an all-cash deal valuing the company at about $2 billion.】

item.title: 即时观点美国 6 月就业增长超出预期
item.description: 美国 6 月份就业增长高于预期，失业率下降，表明劳动力市场稳定。【原文：U.S. job growth in June rose above expectations, while the unemployment rate fell, suggesting the labor market is stable.】

item.title: 法国金融科技公司 Qonto 申请银行牌照，目标是到 2030 年拥有 200 万客户
item.description: 法国金融科技公司 Qonto 周四表示，该公司已向法国银行业监管机构申请银行执照，力图将业务拓展到支付服务之外，提供贷款、储蓄和投资产品。【原文：French fintech Qonto has applied for a banking license with France's banking regulator as it seeks to expand beyond payment services to offer lending, savings and investment products, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国每周新申请失业救济人数降至六周低点
item.description: 上周，新申请失业救济金的美国人数降至六周来的最低点，但在最初一周后继续领取救济金的人数在前一周保持稳定，创下近四年来的最高点。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for jobless benefits fell to a six-week low last week, but the ranks of those continuing to collect benefits after their initial week held steady at the highest in nearly four years in the prior week.】

item.title: 芯片设计商 Ambiq 申请在美国上市
item.description: 半导体设计公司 Ambiq 周四提交了在美国首次公开募股的申请。【原文：Semiconductor designer Ambiq on Thursday filed for an initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 就业报告公布后，交易员减少对美联储降息的押注
item.description: 交易员周四押注，就业市场依然强劲将使美联储在 9 月份之前不会降息，全年降息幅度也不会超过两个季度点。【原文：A still-strong job market will keep the Federal Reserve from cutting interest rates until September, and from delivering more than two quarter-point rate cuts all year, traders bet on Thursday】

item.title: 激进投资者 Starboard Value 披露持有 Tripadvisor 9% 的股份
item.description: 根据周四提交给美国证券交易委员会的一份文件，激进投资者 Starboard Value 披露持有在线旅游公司 Tripadvisor 9% 的股份。【原文：Activist investor Starboard Value disclosed a 9% stake in online travel firm Tripadvisor , according to a filing submitted to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧盟表示，帮助企业遵守人工智能规则的实践准则或将于 2025 年底出台
item.description: 欧盟委员会周四表示，一份旨在帮助数千家公司遵守欧盟具有里程碑意义的人工智能规则的实践准则可能要到2025年底才能发布，这可能意味着要推迟6个多月。【原文：A code of practice designed to help thousands of companies comply with the European Union's landmark artificial intelligence rules may only be issued at the end of 2025, the European Commission said on Thursday, potentially marking a delay of more than six months.】

item.title: Amundi 警告称，美国的稳定币政策可能会破坏全球支付系统的稳定
item.description: 欧洲最大的资产管理公司担心，在美国《GENIUS 法案》颁布后，美元支持的稳定币的繁荣可能会导致资金流的重大转变，从而破坏全球支付系统的稳定。【原文：Europe's largest asset manager has raised concerns that a boom in dollar-backed stablecoins in the wake of the United States' GENIUS Act could cause a major shift in money flows that destabilises the global payment system.】

item.title: 摩根大通任命内部人士大卫-弗雷姆为私人银行全球首席执行官
item.description: 美国银行业巨头摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）周四任命内部人士大卫-弗雷姆（David Frame）为其私人银行全球首席执行官，立即生效。【原文：U.S. banking giant JPMorgan Chase on Thursday named insider David Frame as the global CEO of its private bank, effective immediately.】

item.title: 美国众议院共和党人即将就特朗普的全面减税法案进行最后投票
item.description: 民主党人团结一致反对该法案，但他们本身缺乏阻止议院通过该法案的票数，而特朗普的共和党人以220:212的票数控制着议院。要使最终法案获得通过，共和党人只能承受不超过三票的倒戈。【原文：Democrats are united in opposition to the bill but on their own lack the votes to stop the bill in the chamber, which is controlled 220-212 by Trump's Republicans. Republicans can afford no more than three defections to get a final bill passed.】

item.title: 据 Moneycontrol 报道，凯雷将出售 Piramal Pharma 最多 10%的股份
item.description: 据在线新闻门户 Moneycontrol 周四援引消息人士的话报道，私募股权公司凯雷集团正准备出售印度皮拉马尔制药公司最多 10% 的股份。【原文：Private equity firm Carlyle Group is preparing to offload up to a 10% stake in India's Piramal Pharma , online news portal Moneycontrol reported on Thursday, citing sources.】

item.title: 巴西技术服务公司 C&M 在遭受网络攻击后恢复运营
item.description: 巴西技术服务供应商 C&M 软件公司周四表示，在前一天报告其系统遭到网络攻击后，经央行批准已恢复运营。【原文：Brazilian technology services provider C&M Software has resumed operations with clearance from the central bank, it said on Thursday, after reporting a cyberattack on its systems the previous day.】

item.title: 消息人士称，拉扎德聘请美银美林银行家加强金融保荐部门
item.description: 一位熟悉此举的人士周四表示，投资银行拉扎德（Lazard）已聘请美国银行的比尔-哈特（Bill Hart）领导其金融赞助商部门，主要负责西海岸客户的业务。【原文：Investment bank Lazard has hired Bank of America's Bill Hart to lead their financial sponsors division's coverage focused on West Coast clients, a person familiar with the move said on Thursday.】

item.title: AlixPartners 称，到 2030 年，中国将仅有 15 个电动汽车品牌存活下来
item.description: 咨询公司 AlixPartners 周四表示，由于激烈的竞争迫使企业进行整合，部分企业退出市场，到 2030 年，目前在中国销售电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车的 129 个品牌中，只有 15 个在财务上是可行的。【原文：Only 15 out of the 129 brands that currently sell electric vehicles and plug-in hybrids in China will be financially viable by 2030, as intense competition forces consolidation and some to exit the market, consultancy AlixPartners said on Thursday.】
